FOUND IN: Ian Fleming (creator of James Bond) - While not a traditional author, he is responsible for writing "Goldfinger."
Eczema: An inflammatous skin condition causing itchy, red patches.
Merlin - The legendary wizard from the tales of King Arthur, renowned for his magical abilities and wisdom.
Aristotle - An influential Greek philosopher who made significant contributions in a variety of fields including politics and poetics through his works such as "Politics" and "Poetics."
Door jamb (a component of the doorpost)
Cotton: A soft, fluffy staple fiber that grows in a boll enclosed in a short furry capsule, widely used in textile production.
Ruffled feathers (metaphorical representation of being unsettled or irritated)
Canopus (ancient name for a part of the modern Suez Canal)
